channel.title: Slowing down the delay of projectiles... *Pics!*

item.title: Slowing down the delay of projectiles... *Pics!*
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 861) {
 if(!HasArrows) { 
                                        sendMessage("There's no arrows left in your quiver");
 } else if(HasArrows) {
 createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 70, 249, 43, 43, 0 - AttackingOn);
 PkingDelay = 8;
 wepdelay = 8;
 UseBow = true; 
}
}

Fixed for ya XD

Read full topic

item.title: Slowing down the delay of projectiles... *Pics!*
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

playermanny2:

yea thats wrong

So what then?[quote=“bakatool, post:24, topic:156955”]it’s like this

[code]
public void createProjectile(int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int gfxMoving, int startHeight, int endHeight, int MageAttackIndex) {
try {
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC((casterY-(mapRegionY8))-2);
outStream.writeByteC((casterX-(mapRegionX8))-3);

  outStream.createFrame(117);
  outStream.writeByte(angle); // Starting place of the projectile
  outStream.writeByte(offsetY); // Distance between caster and enemy Y
  outStream.writeByte(offsetX); // Distance between caster and enemy X
  outStream.writeWord(MageAttackIndex); // The NPC the missle is locked on to
  outStream.writeWord(gfxMoving); // The moving graphic ID
  outStream.writeByte(startHeight); // The starting height
  outStream.writeByte(endHeight); // Destination height
  outStream.writeWord(51); // Time the missle is created
  outStream.writeWord(speed); // Speed minus the distance making it set
  outStream.writeByte(16); // Initial slope
  outStream.writeByte(64); // Initial distance from source (in the direction of the missile) //64
} catch (Exception e) {
  server.logError(e.getMessage());
}

}
[/code][/quote]

Wtf are you talking about?

Oh and btw, I found out that I had to declare those ints… the angle, gfx moving, and all that… thats outstreamed…

Like this

public int offsetX = 0; //projectiles related... public int offsetY = 0; public int angle = 0; public int lockon = 0; public int gfxMoving = 0; public int startHeight = 0; public int endHeight = 0; public int speed = 0; //Projectiles end...[br][size=1]Posted on: November 04, 2007, 06:18:45 PM[/size][hr]YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!

OOOOOMMMMMMMGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG!!! IIIIIIIIIIIMMMMMMMMM SSSOOOOOO SSSSSSSMMAAAARRRRRTTTTTT!!!

Dude! It is the 51!!! ALL CUZ OF OPENICE!!! WOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!! YOU HAVE TO INCREASE THE 51 SINCE MY WEPDELAY AND PKINGDELAY ARE 8… SO NOW I ONLY SHOOT ONE!!! YEEAAAAHHHHHHH!!!

But I did it differently, I changed the 51 to timeCreate, then went to my “ints” area, and added timeCreate = 51;

then under my crystal bow, I added timeCreate = 70; and now its perfect!!! Wooooo! Definitely repped openice, tho I doubt that you had any idea you helped… lol

70% to openice and 30% to me by added the int…

Read full topic
item.source: Slowing down the delay of projectiles... *Pics!*

item.title: Slowing down the delay of projectiles... *Pics!*
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

it’s like this

  public void createProjectile(int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int gfxMoving, int startHeight, int endHeight, int MageAttackIndex) {
    try {
      outStream.createFrame(85);
      outStream.writeByteC((casterY-(mapRegionY*8))-2);
      outStream.writeByteC((casterX-(mapRegionX*8))-3);
      outStream.createFrame(117);
      outStream.writeByte(angle); // Starting place of the projectile
      outStream.writeByte(offsetY); // Distance between caster and enemy Y
      outStream.writeByte(offsetX); // Distance between caster and enemy X
      outStream.writeWord(MageAttackIndex); // The NPC the missle is locked on to
      outStream.writeWord(gfxMoving); // The moving graphic ID
      outStream.writeByte(startHeight); // The starting height
      outStream.writeByte(endHeight); // Destination height
      outStream.writeWord(51); // Time the missle is created
      outStream.writeWord(speed); // Speed minus the distance making it set
      outStream.writeByte(16); // Initial slope
      outStream.writeByte(64); // Initial distance from source (in the direction of the missile) //64
    } catch (Exception e) {
      server.logError(e.getMessage());
    }
  }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

Naw, thats the SPEED OF the arrow, like how fast it flies, but not how many to show in how long of time, so if I increased the number (Meaning slowing it down…), you’ll just see 3 really close together arrows flying, like really slow… and if you lower the number, than you’ll see 3 really fast arrows… but its still 3 for some reason…

@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

sweet k, so like this? if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 861) { if(!HasArrows){ sendMessage("There's no arrows left in your quiver"); else if(HasArrows){ createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 70, 249, 43, 43, 0 - AttackingOn); PkingDelay = 8; wepdelay = 8; UseBow = true; }[br][size=1]Posted on: November 04, 2007, 04:57:32 PM[/size][hr][quote=“tobias222, post:8, topic:156955”]No, its the gfx, the still gfx is the graphics for the crysal bow special, which makes three arrows come out (its just part of the gfx) try changing to a normal arrow or the composite magic bow special is just one arrow but with a white outline :)[/quote]
